security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides examples for using the Flow Nexus MCP server. No executable code or local file access. The skill orchestrates cloud-based AI agent swarms via external MCP tools. Risk is low due to transparent cloud dependency and documented data flow.

content.user_title: Deploy AI Agent Swarms in the Cloud
content.value_statement: Managing complex AI agent workflows across multiple agents is difficult and slow. Flow Nexus Swarm provides cloud-based orchestration with message queues and intelligent agent coordination for scalable multi-agent automation.
actual_capabilities: Initialize AI agent swarms with hierarchical, mesh, ring, or star topologies
Create and execute event-driven workflows with parallel and sequential steps
Spawn specialized agents (researcher, coder, analyst, optimizer, coordinator)
Monitor swarm status, workflow metrics, and audit trails
Use pre-built templates for full-stack development, research, and CI/CD pipelines
Scale agent swarms dynamically based on workload
limitations: Requires active Flow Nexus account and MCP server configuration
Depends on external cloud service (flow-nexus.ruv.io) for execution
Limited to workflows defined through Flow Nexus MCP tools

use_cases.title: Multi-Agent Development
use_cases.description: Coordinate backend, frontend, database, and QA agents for complete project delivery

use_cases.title: Automated CI/CD Pipelines
use_cases.description: Build testing, building, and deployment workflows with automated rollback

use_cases.title: Distributed Research
use_cases.description: Parallel information gathering and analysis across multiple research agents

prompt_templates.title: Initialize Swarm
prompt_templates.prompt: Initialize a {topology} swarm with {n} agents for {purpose}

prompt_templates.title: Create Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a workflow called {name} with these steps: {step_descriptions}

prompt_templates.title: Execute Task
prompt_templates.prompt: Orchestrate this task across the swarm: {task_description}

prompt_templates.title: Monitor Status
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the status of swarm {swarm_id} including metrics and pending messages

output_examples.input: Initialize a hierarchical swarm with 6 agents for a web application project
output: Agents spawned: Project Manager, Backend Developer, Frontend Developer, Database Architect, QA Engineer, DevOps Engineer

best_practices: Choose topology based on project complexity: star for simple, hierarchical for complex
Use vector similarity matching for optimal agent-to-task assignment
Implement retry policies and timeouts for long-running workflows
anti_patterns: Using the wrong topology for your workflow type
Creating workflows without dependency management between steps
Running all agents at max capacity without workload monitoring

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through the Flow Nexus MCP server.

faq.question: How many agents can I run simultaneously?
faq.answer: Agent limits depend on your Flow Nexus account tier. Check flow-nexus.ruv.io for details.

faq.question: How does this integrate with local execution?
faq.answer: Flow Nexus provides cloud orchestration. Use claude-flow MCP for local swarm coordination.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill requires the external Flow Nexus cloud platform. Review their privacy policy.

faq.question: What happens if the cloud service is unavailable?
faq.answer: Workflows will fail to execute until the service recovers. Implement error handling in your workflows.

faq.question: How is this different from claude-flow swarm?
faq.answer: Flow Nexus runs in the cloud with auto-scaling. Claude-flow provides local-only swarm coordination.
